Package javax.sdp

The package javax.sdp contains the classes for encoding and decoding SDP messages.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Attribute An Attribute represents an a= fields contained within either a MediaDescription or a SessionDescription.
Bandwidth A Bandwidth represents the b= fields contained within either a MediaDescription or a SessionDescription.
Connection A Connection represents the c= field associated with a SessionDescription or with an individual MediaDescription and is used to identify a network address on which media can be received.
EMail An EMail represents an e= field contained within a SessionDescription.
Field A Field represents a single line of information within a SDP session description.
Info An Info represents the i= fields contained within either a MediaDescription or a SessionDescription.
Key A Key represents the k= field contained within either a MediaDescription or a SessionDescription.
Media A Media represents an m= field contained within a MediaDescription.
MediaDescription A MediaDescription identifies the set of medias that may be received on a specific port or set of ports.
Origin An Origin represents the o= fields contained within a SessionDescription.
Phone A Phone represents a p= field contained within a SessionDescription.
RepeatTime A RepeatTime represents a r= field contained within a TimeDescription.
SdpConstants The SdpConstants class contains the RTP/AVP related constants.
SdpEncoder A SdpEncoder serializes SessionDescription objects in a customizable manner.
SdpFactory The SdpFactory enables applications to encode and decode SDP messages.
SessionDescription A SessionDescription represents the data defined by the Session Description Protocol (see IETF RFC 2327) and holds information about the originitor of a session, the media types that a client can support and the host and port on which the client will listen for that media.
SessionName A SessionName represents the s= fields contained within a SessionDescription.
Time A Time represents a t= field contained within a TimeDescription.
TimeDescription A TimeDescription represents the fields present within a SDP time description.
TimeZoneAdjustment A TimeZoneAdjustment represents the z= fields contained within a TimeDescription.
URI An URI represents the u= field within a SessionDescription.
Version A Version field represents the v= fields contained within the SessionDescription.
 

Class Summary
SdpFactoryFinder Created by IntelliJ IDEA.
 

Exception Summary
SdpException The SdpException defines a general exception for the SDP classes to throw when they encounter a difficulty.
SdpParseException The SdpParseException encapsulates the information thrown when an error occurs during SDP parsing.
 

Package javax.sdp Description

The package javax.sdp contains the classes for encoding and decoding SDP messages.

This package contains the following interfaces/classes:

Description Interfaces
These interfaces constitute the large collections of data within a SessionDescription.

SessionDescription
The SessionDescription contains information about the overall session. It includes one or more MediaDescriptions and one or more TimeDescriptions.
TimeDescription
The TimeDescription includes the dates and times which the session is valid.
MediaDescription
A MediaDescription includes information about a media stream include within the session.

Field Interfaces
These interfaces represent the values of a field within a SessionDescription.

Version
A Version field represents the v= fields contained within the SessionDescription.
Origin
An Origin represents the o= fields contained within a SessionDescription.
SessionName
A SessionName represents the s= fields contained within a SessionDescription.
Info
An Info represents the i= fields contained within either a MediaDescription or a SessionDescription.
URI
An URI represents the u= field within a SessionDescription.
EMail
An EMail represents an e= field contained within a SessionDescription.
Phone
A Phone represents a p= field contained within a SessionDescription.
Connection
A Connection represents the c= field associated with a SessionDescription or with an individual MediaDescription and is used to identify a network address on which media can be received.
Bandwidth
A Bandwidth represents the b= fields contained within either a MediaDescription or a SessionDescription.
Time
A Time represents a t= field contained within a TimeDescription.
RepeatTime
A RepeatTime represents a r= field contained within a TimeDescription.
TimeZoneAdjustment
A TimeZoneAdjustment represents the z= fields contained within a TimeDescription.
Key
A Key represents the k= field contained within either a MediaDescription or a SessionDescription.
Attribute
An Attribute represents an a= fields contained within either a MediaDescription or a SessionDescription.
Media
A Media represents an m= field contained within a MediaDescription.

SdpFactory Class
The SdpFactory is used to create descriptions and fields.

SdpFactory
The SdpFactory offers all the factory methods to parse or construct new SDP message elements.

SdpException Classes
The SdpException classes encapsulate the error types presented by javax.sdp.

SdpException
The general class of exceptions generated by the SDP library.
SdpParseException
These exceptions result from parsing errors.

The SdpFactory serves as the primary interface for both encoding and decoding SDP messages.

In order to encode a SDP message, create an an empty SDP message and populate it. First, create a SessionDescription by calling SdpFactory.createSessionDescription(). Then populate it by adding the necessary elements - create the element using SdpFactory and then set/add the value to the SessionDescription.

...

SdpFactory factory = SdpFactoryFinder.getSdpFactory ();

SessionDescription sd = factory.createSessionDescription();

// v

Version v = factory.createVersion(1);

sd.setVersion(v);

// o

Origin o = factory.createOrigin("u1", 23, 34, "IN", "IP4", "126.16.64.4");

sd.setOrigin(o);

// s

SessionName sn = factory.createSessionName("new session name");

sd.setSessionName(sn);

// i

Info info = factory.createInfo("Description2");

sd.setInfo(info);

// u

URL url = new URL("http://new.com");

URI uri = factory.createURI(url);

sd.setURI(uri);

// e

EMail em = factory.createEMail("cross@dynamicsoft.com");

sd.getEmails(true).addElement (em);

// p

Phone p1 = factory.createPhone("12345678990");

sd.getPhones(true).addElement (p1);

// c

Connection c = factory.createConnection("IN", "IP6", "[5.5.5.5.5.5]");

sd.setConnection(c);

// b

Bandwidth b = factory.createBandwidth("X-55", 55);

sd.getBandwidths(true), b);

Date start = new Date();

Date stop = new Date(start.getTime () + 60000);

// t

TimeDescription td = factory.createTimeDescription(start, stop);

// a

Attribute a = factory.createAttribute("newAttribute", "newValue");

sd.getAttributes(true).addElement (a);

// m

String[] formats = new String [1];

formats [0] = "0";

MediaDescription md = factory.createMediaDescription ("audio", 8000, 1, "RTP/AVP", formats);

sd.getMediaDescriptions (true).addElement (md);

....

In order to decode a SDP message, store the message in a String and pass it to SdpFactory.createSessionDescription(String)

StringBuffer sb = ...

SessionDescription sd = factory.createSessionDescription(sb.toString());

The method returns a SessionDescription that can be interrogated for the content of the message.

Origin o = sd.getOrigin ();

...
